newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austria may miss EMU deficit target - WIFO economist.
newsitem.headline: Austria may miss EMU deficit target - WIFO economist.

text.p: Austria risks missing the budget deficit target for membership of a single European currency because of an overshoot in central government's budget this year, a leading Austrian economist said on Tuesday.

Gerhard Lehner, of the semi-official economic research institute WIFO, quoted a finance ministry document that he said forecast a 12 billion schillings shortfall in the central government budget this year.
No one at the finance ministry was immediately available for comment.
Lehner told Austrian radio the shortfall would push the government's budget deficit to 3.2 percent of GDP instead of a planned 2.7 percent.
"This puts the onus on regional governments...The paper sees them delivering a 0.2 percent surplus to bring Austria back to the required three percent of GDP," he said.
Under the 1997 budget agreement, the regions are allowed a budget deficit of 0.3 percent of GDP. -- Janet McBride, Vienna newsroom +43-1 531 12 254
